item.title: Unreal: Creating static mesh assets from C++
item.description: I was looking for information on creating static mesh assets in Unreal from C++, and found a blog post that covered exactly that… in version 4.16. I was working on an editor plugin for Unreal 5.0.1, and there were a few changes needed before it would compile. Before I get into what I had to change, here’s the sample; it creates a pyramid shape from a set of vertices with positions and UVs, and lets Unreal compute the normals and tangents.

item.title: OpenSimplex Noise in Go
item.description: NOTE: As of early 2022, the Simplex noise patent has expired. Still, the opensimplex-go repo’s test case .json is a convenient starting point for anyone who needs to write a new opensimplex implementation. One of my Go projects uses procedurally-generated terrain â€” which means I want smooth random noise. Perlin noise is a common choice, and there are existing Go implementations, but Perlin noise suffers from axis-aligned artifacts. Ken Perlin’s successor to Perlin noise (Simplex) fixes those problems, but adds a worse one: it’s patented.
